Job Title: Expert Consultant, Tech Insights Group

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Information Technology, Sales

Description:
WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORKWe are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are a Glassdoor Best Place to Work and we have maintained a spot in the top four since its founding in 2009. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration are key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. WHO YOU’LL WORK WITHTech Insights Practice Overview
Technology Insights Group (TIG) at Bain & Company is a rapidly growing global team of world-class technologists. We work with leading Private Equity (PE) investors and their tech-enabled portfolio companies to act as technical advisors in investment processes. We conduct product and technology due diligence engagements and value creation assignments, leveraging our extensive expertise in software and understanding of commercial environments specific to tech-enabled businesses. The Global Technology Insights Group team consists of technology savvy consultants and former CTOs and CPOs of leading global technology and software companies with decades of both advising and operating experience. The team has completed 400+ product and technology diligences and value creation engagements worldwide.  Over the past 24 months, we supported our clients on some of the most visible technology investments in the US and Europe, including several of the Top 2022 and Top 2023 software deals. We conduct engagements spanning enterprise applications, vertical applications (HCIT, FinTech, EdTech), infrastructure software, cloud software, and tech enabled services (IT services, e-Commerce, AdTech). Bain’s Tech Insights practice is a place where agile minds work powerfully and nimbly together, thriving on spirited discussion. WHAT YOU’LL DOJoining Technology Insights Group (TIG)is an exciting opportunity to build a new and critical capability at Bain. You will work closely with the global Tech leadership and the regional private equity (PE) teams.  At Bain, you will leverage your technology and consulting experience in actively contributing to projects, assessing key aspects of leading software companies for PE investors.  You will help our clients strategically approach how technology will shape their businesses and solve some of the most challenging issues they face. Working alongside an outstanding group of individuals, you will develop and enhance your own technology expertise, commercial acumen, and analytical capabilities. Additionally, you will gain direct exposure to CEOs, Executives, and Private Equity professionals. Whether your long-term goal is to grow with us, join a PE/VC firm, or to start the next great technology company, you will build a fantastic foundation by joining our multi-talented and highly motivated team.Responsibilities in Detail:Lead and drive technology due diligence and value creation assignments on behalf of PE investors targeting software businesses.Actively contribute across the entire client engagement, from formulating the project scope to building and presenting the final report. Drive and support the primary and secondary research efforts of the team; collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data across a variety of sources.Conduct hypothesis-led problem solving, communicate complex ideas, and approach problems strategically.Effectively develop and communicate recommendations and insights to the project team, PE investors, and technology leaders.Help to build and scale a new business, act as thought partner to Tech leadership on our growth and strategy.Enhance Bain’s Tech Insights Groups brand through external reputation building and marketing efforts.Invest in special initiatives and projects that help us scale the practice (ops/systems) ABOUT YOUThe Expert Consultant, Technology Insights Group role requires passion for transformation, an entrepreneurial spirit, empathy, and technical aptitude. The following are highly valued: Passion for softwareDemonstrate a passion for software as well as the tech industry more broadly (e.g., digital transformation, disruptive business models).3+ years in a software or technology related position or industry; Technical diligence experience preferred.Ability to rapidly absorb and interpret technical information. Inquisitive mindset and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment.Client service orientation and EQPassion for delivering high-impact client results in a fast-paced, evolving environment. Exceptional interpersonal skills and emotional agility, ability to interface across any level at Bain and client organizations.Outstanding oral and written communication skills.Entrepreneurial mindset and teamwork Desire to join a rapidly growing startup within a leading strategy consulting firmEntrepreneurial, curious, creative, and innovative thinking.Strong alignment with Bain operating principles.Strong teamwork ethos and ability to work with team members with diverse skills and backgrounds in an inclusive fashion.Management potentialDemonstrated potential for developing and coaching junior team members.Direct management experience in a consulting or operating line preferred.Strong analytical capabilities and backgroundAnalytical and data-driven mindset.Aptitude for creative, quantitative, and qualitative problem solving.Undergraduate/Master’s degree from a top tier university in a relevant field (i.e., computer science, engineering, business management, information systems). MBA and Top tier consulting experience preferred but not required.  U.S. Compensation Information Compensation for this role includes base salary, annual discretionary performance bonus, 401(k) plan with an annual employer contribution based on years of service and Bain’s best in class benefits package (details listed below).  Some local governments in the United States require a good-faith, reasonable salary range be included in job postings for open roles. The estimated annualized compensation for this role is as follows: - In New York City, the good-faith, reasonable annualized full-time salary range for this role is between $157,000 – $184,500; placement within this range will vary based on several factors including, but not limited to experience, education, licensure/certifications, training and skill level. - For all other locations, the good-faith, reasonable annualized full-time salary range for this role is commensurate with competitive geographic market rates for this role and will vary based on several factors including, but not limited to experience, education, licensure/certifications, training and skill level  - Annual discretionary performance bonus  - This role may also be eligible for other elements of discretionary compensation  - 4.5% 401(k) company contribution, which increases after 3 years of service and is 100% vested upon start date  Bain & Company's comprehensive benefits and wellness program is designed to help employees achieve personal independence, protection and stability in the areas most important to you and your family.  - Bain pays 100% individual employee premiums for medical, dental and vision programs, offering one of the most comprehensive medical plans for employees without impacting your paycheck - Generous paid time off, including parental leave, sick leave and paid holidays - Fully vested 401(k) company contribution - Paid Life and Long-Term Disability insurance - Annual fitness reimbursements

Experience Level (if available): None
